question: The energy used by a 1.5 kW heater in 5 minutes is: (a) 5 J (b) 450 J (c) 7500 J (d) 450 000 J
The length of a certain conductor of resistance 100 ohm is doubled and its cross-sectional area is halved. Its new resistance is: (a) 100 ohm (b) 200 ohm (c) 50 ohm (d) 400 ohm
The resistance of a 2 km length of cable of cross-sectional area 2 mm² and resistivity of $2 \times 10^{-8}$ ohm-m is: (a) 0.02 ohm (b) 20 ohm (c) 0.02 mohm (d) 200 ohm
A piece of graphite has a cross-sectional area of 10 mm². If its resistance is 0.1 ohm and its resistivity $10 \times 10^{-8}$ ohm-m, its length is: (a) 10 km (b) 10 cm (c) 10 mm (d) 10 m
A coil of wire has a resistance of 10 ohm at 0°C. If the temperature coefficient of resistance for the wire is 0.004/°C, its resistance at 100°C is: (a) 0.4 ohm (b) 1.4 ohm (c) 14 ohm (d) 10 ohm
A nickel coil has a resistance of 13 $\Omega$ at 50°C. If the temperature coefficient of resistance at 0°C is 0.006/°C, the resistance at 0°C is: (a) 16.9 ohm (b) 10 ohm (c) 43.3 ohm (d) 0.1 ohm
A colour coding of red-violet-black on a resistor indicates a value of: (a) 27 ohm ± 20% (b) 270 ohm (c) 270 ohm ± 20% (d) 27 ohm ± 10%
A resistor marked as 4K7G indicates a value of: (a) 47 ohm ± 20% (b) 4.7 k-ohm ± 20% (c) 0.47 ohm ± 10% (d) 4.7 k-ohm ± 2%

For the series-parallel arrangement shown, find the p.d. across the 6-ohm resistor: (Circuit diagram shows $R_1=2.5\Omega$ in series with a parallel branch of $R_2=6\Omega$ and $R_3=2\Omega$, followed by $R_4=4\Omega$ in series, all connected to 200V) (a) 34.5 V (b) 25.4 V (c) 37.5 V (d) 75.5 V

For the circuit shown, the total resistance of the circuit is 100 ohm, determine the value of resistor R2. (Circuit diagram shows $R_1$, $R_2$, $R_3$ in series with voltages 10V, 4V, and $V_3$ respectively across them, connected to a 25V source)
A 12V battery is connected in a circuit having three series-connected resistors having resistances of 4 ohm, 9 ohm and 11 ohm. Find the power dissipated in the 11 ohm resistor.
The p.d’s measured across three resistors connected in series are 5V, 7V and 10V, and the supply current is 2A. Determine the values of the three resistors.

When the switch in the circuit shown is closed the reading on voltmeter 1 is 30V and that on voltmeter 2 is 10V. Determine the reading on the ammeter and the value of resistor R. (Circuit diagram shows a 5$\Omega$ resistor in parallel with $R_x$, with an ammeter in the main line and two voltmeters $V_1$ and $V_2$)
The electric flux density between two plates separated by polystyrene of relative permittivity 2.5 is 5 μC/m². Find the voltage gradient between the plates.

Two parallel plates having a p.d. of 250V between them are spaced 1 mm apart. Determine the electric field strength. Find also the electric flux density when the dielectric between the plates is mica of relative permittivity 5.
A waxed paper capacitor has two parallel plates, each of effective area 0.2 m². If the capacitance is 4000 pF determine the effective thickness of the paper if its relative permittivity is 2.
Calculate the capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor having 5 plates, each 30 mm by 20 mm and separated by a dielectric 0.75 mm thick having a relative permittivity of 2.3.

A parallel plate capacitor is made from 25 plates, each 70 mm by 120 mm interleaved with mica of relative permittivity 5. If the capacitance of the capacitor is 3000 pF determine the thickness of the mica sheet.
The capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor is 1000 pF. It has 19 plates, each 50 mm by 30 mm separated by a dielectric of thickness 0.40 mm. Determine the relative permittivity of the dielectric.
Capacitors of 2 μF and 6 μF are connected in parallel in series. Determine the equivalent capacitance in each case.
